text: hey guys Thomas Joseph here and today
i'm sharing with you four must-have
grilling tips for this summer grilling
season I'm indoors of course but any of
these tips you can apply to outdoor
grilling the first two tips I'm going to
start here with steaks getting a nice
hot sear and removing it from that
direct heat to indirect heat once it
gets a nice crust so that it can finish
cooking without burning so in front of
me I have a 10 ounce strip steak here
this is about an inch in thickness and
what I'm gonna do first is I'm going to
heat my grill pan or heat your grill up
to a nice medium-high heat and a way to
gauge whether or not your grill is hot
enough is to actually use your hand to
sense the heat you don't want your hand
to be able to last there for very long
so what this is telling me right now is
that I need to let my grill pan heat up
just a little bit more so while this is
heating I'm going to take a paper towel
with a little bit of canola oil
grapeseed oil any neutral oil that can
go to a high heat and you want to brush
your grades of your grill with this oil
and this will help in preventing any
food from sticking now if you're outside
on your BBQ with the direct flame use a
pair of tongs here I'm very important
now I'm gonna flip my steak
whenever you're grilling something
that's quite thick you want to make sure
that you liberally season it because the
majority of the seasoning is actually
going to fall off the steak so my grill
is nice and hot I can only keep my hand
there for a few seconds so you know that
it's ready to grill and I'm going to
place my steak on a diagonal so I get
some nice grill marks now what happens
if you place your meat on a cold grill
in front of me I have two versions a
steak that has been grilled on a cool
grill to start off with which gives you
this gray exterior because what's
actually happening is the meat is
steaming it's not searing so you get a
gray outside to your steak when
really what you're looking for is a dark
crust like the version I have here and
what you need to do is start off with a
really really hot grill so it's been
about two minutes I'm going to rotate
the steak now so that I get those
wonderful grill marks and another two
minutes before I flip it on its other
side you can see that it has really nice
grill marks here and again we're going
to do another two minutes and then we're
going to shift it in another two minutes
more I'm going to take my steak off of
the grill and transfer this now to an
indirect heat now since I'm indoors
indirect heat means the oven but if
you're using a gas grill or a charcoal
grill you're going to want to shift the
heat to the exterior of your grill so
that means you turn off the middle knob
and you finish cooking the steak in the
center of the grill that creates almost
like an oven to finish cooking since I'm
transferring this to the oven I like to
make sure that I use a rack on top of a
sheet tray so that the steak doesn't
steam on the bottom now this should be
used whenever you're making something
that's really thick like a pork chop a
bone-in chicken breast or a thick steak
like this so that is must have grill tip
number two finishing on indirect heat
must have tip number three how to avoid
flare ups because flare-ups on the grill
can give you this blackened exterior
when all you're really looking for is a
wonderfully brown exterior like this
burger here now how do you avoid that
well when it comes to burgers you want
to make sure that the fat ratio isn't
too great and that you don't coat the
food in too much marinade and that will
help to prevent flare-ups now for a
burger I'm gonna season just as I did
the steak I've old my grill not the meat
and I'm going to place my burgers right
on the heat so that is your must-have
grilling tip number three avoiding
flare-ups for grilling tip number four
we're tackling the kabobs whenever
you're using wooden skewers you want to
make sure that you soak them for at
least thirty minutes so that the wood
does not burn on your grill the second
tip would be arranging your vegetables
your meats on their own skewers so that
they can
cook evenly and then the third tip is
using two skewers during the cooking
process the hole that's created by the
kebab gets bigger so your food starts
rotating around the skewer has that ever
happened to you so when you go and
actually try to flip it on your grill
the food itself doesn't flip well this
is a sure way to avoid that because the
whole thing will just flip over nicely
another helpful tip for making kebabs is
that whatever you're grilling you want
the size to be a little bit greater than
an inch because if they're too small
they're gonna fall off your skewers so
now I'm gonna season these up with a
little bit of salt and pepper and so
these go right onto your oiled grill and
now you know your vegetables will cook
evenly because they're all together your
shrimp will cook evenly because that's
together and you will have perfectly
